question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following sets.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13-Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting / multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is NOT allowed)

(8, 44, 3)

(12, 60, 3)
solution:
(a)Logic: (First No. + Third No.) × 4 = Second No.

(8, 44, 3) → (8 + 3) × 4 = 11 × 4 = 44

(12, 60, 3) → (12 + 3) × 4 = 15 × 4 = 60

Similarly,

(12, 68, 5) → (12 + 5) × 4 = 17 × 4 = 68

question:
Select the correct combination of mathematical signs to sequentially replace * the signs and to balance the given equation.

150 * 3 * 10 * 2 * 7 * 46
solution:
(a)In this type of questions we will check options one by one and doing so option a gets satisfied.

150 * 3 * 10 * 2 * 7 * 46

Putting the signs of option (a) in the given equation we get,

150 ÷ 3 + 10 - 2 × 7 = 46

L.H.S. = 150 ÷ 3 + 10 - 2 × 7

⇒ 50 + 10 - 14

⇒ 60 - 14 = 46 = R.H.S.

question:
Select the set in which the number are related in the same way as the numbers of the given sets.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 -Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

(31, 47, 35)

(51, 67, 55)
solution:
(c)Logic: (3rd no. - 1stno.)²+ 1stno. = 2nd no.

(31, 47, 35) → (35 - 31)² + 31 = 47

(51, 67, 55) → (55 - 51)² + 51 = 67

Similarly,

(13, 29, 17) → (17 - 13)² + 13 = 29

question: Three of the following four triads are alike in a certain way as they are formed by performing the same mathematical operations among themselves and thus form a group. Which triad does NOT belong to that group?
solution:
(c)Logic: (Second number - Third number)² = First number

36 : 13 : 7 → (13 - 7)² = 36

16 : 9 : 5 → (9 - 5)² = 16

1 : 3 : 2 → (3 - 2)² = 1

But, 72 : 16 : 8 → (16 - 8)² = 64 (Not 72)

question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

294 + 14 × 4 ÷ 16 - 67 = 33
solution:
(a)In this type of questions we will check options one by one and doing so option a gets satisfied.

294 + 14 × 4 ÷ 16 - 67 = 33

Interchanging the signs + and ÷ in the given equation we get,

294 ÷ 14 × 4 + 16 - 67 = 33

L.H.S = 294 ÷ 14 × 4 + 16 - 67

21 × 4 + 16 - 67

84 + 16 - 67 = 33 = R.H.S

question: 26. Which of the following musical instruments were played by the musicians such as Shakoor Khan and Pandit Ram Narayan?
solution: (a)Sarangi. Ustad Shakoor Khan - Belongs to Kirana Gharana. Pandit Ram Narayan - Sarangi player. Some musical instrument players: Sarangi - Ustad Sultan Khan, Ustad Hafizullah Khan, Pandit Ram Narayan, Sultan Khan and Zakir Hussain. Shehnai - Ustad bismillah khan, Anant Lal, Pandit Ram Sahay, Ali Ahmed Hussain Khan. Guitar - Jayanthi Kumaresh, Veenai Dhanammal.

question: According to IBEF 2021, the Indian pharmaceutical industry ranks ______ in the world on the basis of volume.
solution: (d)3rd. IBEF (India Brand Equity Foundation) - It is a Trust established by the Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce and Industry. Objective:- To promote and create international awareness of the Made in India label in markets overseas and facilitating the dissemination of knowledge of Indian products and services. Founded: 2003. Headquarters- New Delhi.

question: When did Linus Carl Pauling receive the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for 'his research into the nature of the chemical bond and its applications to the elucidation of the structure of complex substances'?
solution: (a)1954. Nobel Prize (1901) - Linus Carl Pauling was also awarded with the Nobel Peace Prize (1962). Some Scientists who won Nobel Prize in Chemistry :- Otto Paul Hermann Diels and Kurt Alder (1950) - “for their discovery and development of the diene synthesis”. Sir Cyril Norman Hinshelwood and Nikolay Semenov (1956) - “for their research into the mechanism of chemical reactions”. Frederick Sanger (1958)- “for his work on the structure of proteins, especially that of insulin”.

question: Daskathia of ___________ is the tribal dance performed by two males depicting the historic and Puranic events.
solution: (d)Odisha. Daskathia (Folk theatre form, associated with the worship of Lord Shiva). Some Folk theatre form:- Bhavai (Rajasthan), Garodas (Gujarat), Jatra (Odisha), Kariyila (Himachal Pradesh), Maach (Madhya Pradesh), Swang (Punjab and Haryana), Ojapali (Assam), Powada (Maharashtra), Tamasha (Maharashtra), Bhand Pather (Jammu and Kashmir), Bhaona (Assam), Dashavatar (Konkan area), Naqal (Punjab) or Bhand (Uttar Pradesh).

question: KA Najeeb Vs Union of India case deals with violation of rights under_____________.
solution: (b)Article 21 (Protection of life and personal liberty). Important Cases related to Article 21: A.K Gopalan vs the State of Madras 1951: The Supreme court has taken a narrow interpretation of Article 21 in this case. Maneka Gandhi vs. UOI, 1978: In this case, the SC overruled its judgment of the Gopalan Case by taking a wider interpretation of Article 21. Article 16 - Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment. Article 14 - Equality before the law. Article 19 - Protection of certain rights regarding, freedom of speech, etc.

question: Which of the following is the red algae?
solution: (a)Rhodophyta (Red algae). Algae are photosynthetic organisms that possess photosynthetic pigments such as chlorophyll. Types of Algae: Euglenophyta (Euglenoids), Chrysophyta (Golden-brown algae and Diatoms), Pyrrophyta (Fire algae), Chlorophyta (Green algae), Phaeophyta (Brown algae), Xanthophyta (Yellow-green algae). Examples : Diatom, Wakame, Ulothrix, Fucus, Porphyra, Spirogyra.

question: 32. What will be the atomic number of an element X which is placed in period 2 and group 17 ?
solution: (d)9, Fluorine (F). Group 17 (Halogen elements):- Chlorine (Cl, 17), Bromine (Br, 35), Iodine (I, 53), Astatine (At, 85), and Tennessine (Ts, 117). Properties:- Melting and Boiling Points (increase down the group), Atomic Radius (increases down the group), Ionization Energy (decreases down the group), Electronegativity (decreases down the group), Electron Affinity (decreases down the group).

question: In which two consecutive years was there no chief guest at the Republic Day celebrations of India?
solution: (a)2021 and 2022. First Republic Day was celebrated on January 26, 1950, Ahmed Sukarno, the President of Indonesia was the chief guest. 74th Republic Day: Chief guest - President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of the Arab Republic of Egypt. Best parade: Uttarakhand's tableau. The Constitution of India came into effect on 26 January 1950.

question: Fisher's quantity theory is explained by his famous equation given as__________.
solution: (b)MV = PT. Fisher Equation states that the nominal interest rate is equal to the sum of the real interest rate plus inflation. It lies at the heart of the Quantity Theory of Money. MV=PT, where M = Money Supply, V= Velocity of circulation, P= Price Level, and T = Transactions.

question: Before the rise of the modern industrial system, Indian exports consisted chiefly of manufactures like______________.
solution: (d)Cotton and silk fabrics. The first cotton mill was established by the Bombay Spinning and Weaving Company (1854), in Bombay. The first modern silk textile factory in India was started by the East India Company at Howrah in 1832.

question: The Kanchenjunga peak is located in which sub-division of Himalaya from the following?
solution: (b)Darjeeling and Sikkim Himalayas. Kashmir Himalayas (Highest peak - K2 Godwin). Himachal and Uttaranchal Himalayas span three states Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. Arunachal Himalayas (East of Bhutan Himalayas to the Diphu pass in the East) - Highest Peak is Kangto (also known as Kanggardo Rize). Punjab Himalayas - Between the Indus and Sutlej rivers. Kumaon Himalayas - Between Satluj and Kali rivers.

question: Guru Bipin Singh, a Nrityacharya awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi awardee and Kalidas Samman awardee, was renowned for promoting which classical dance form?
solution: (a)Manipuri. Awards of Guru Bipin Singh - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1989), Title of Hanjaba by the Maharaja of Manipur. Famous Dancers : Manipuri - Yumlembam Gambhini Devi, Darshana Jhaveri, Nirmala Mehta. Kuchipudi - Kaushalya Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Bhavana Reddy, Atisha Pratap Singh, Haleem Khan. Odissi - Sonal Mansingh, Jhelum Paranjape, Mayadhar Raut, Gangadhar Pradhan, Leana Citaristi, Leena Mohanty. Kathak - Pandit Birju Maharaj, Lachu Maharaj, Shambu Maharaj, Shovna Narayan, Kumari Kamala, Sunanya Hazarilal Agarwal.

question: Who holds the authority of transferring judges from one High court to another High Court?
option_1: The senior most judge of Supreme Court
solution: (c)The President of India (Article 52). Article 222 - Transfer of a Judge from one High Court to another. Article 217 -Appointment and conditions of the office of a Judge of a High Court. Article 124 - Establishment and constitution of the Supreme Court. Article 218 - Application of certain provisions relating to the Supreme Court to High Courts. Article 214 - High Courts for States.

question: _____________is the process of complete or incomplete oxidation or hydrolysis of fats and oils when exposed to air, light, moisture, or bacterial action that spoils food.
solution: (a)Rancidification (Examples- milk becomes rancid because of not heating it in the humid atmosphere, Oil becomes rancid (rancid oil) because of the decomposition of fats it has) . Oxidation - It is defined as the addition of oxygen to the substance or the removal of hydrogen from the substance. Reduction - It is defined as the addition of hydrogen to the substance or the removal of oxygen from the substance. Hydrogenation - It is an addition reaction where hydrogen molecules are used to saturate organic compounds. AutoOxidation - It is the spontaneous oxidation of a compound in air.

question: Which of the following is a Tibeto-Burmese language?
solution: (b)Tripuri (Kokborok) - One of the official languages of Tripura. It is spoken in Tripura, and neighbouring areas of Bangladesh. Kokborok Day (Tripuri Language Day) - 19th January. Other Tibeto Burmese languages - Burmese, Tibetan, Bai, Yi (Lolo), Karen, Meitei, Hani, Jingpo. Tulu is a Dravidian language spoken mainly in two coastal districts Dakshina Kannada and Udupi of Karnataka and Kasaragod district of Kerala.

question: Who among the following was the author of the play 'Mrichchhakatika'?
solution: (c)Shudraka. Mrichchhakatika play was translated into English by Arthur W. Ryder in 1905 as “The Little Clay”. Other Sanskrit plays of Shudraka: “Vinavasavadatta”, and “Padmaprabhritaka”, “a bhana” (short one-act monologue). Books of other Authors: Kalidasa - “Meghaduta”, “Abhigyan Shakuntalam”, “Vikramorvashiyam”, “Malavikagnimitram”, “Kumarasambhava”. Bhasa - “Svapnavasavadatta”. Amarasimha - “Amarakosha”.

question: Select the FALSE statement from the given options.
option_1: Baikal rocks are formed from the dissolved materials that precipitate from the solution.
option_2: The sedimentary rocks are formed by the deposition and subsequent cementation of that material within bodies of water and at the surface of the earth.
option_3: Metamorphic rocks may be formed simply by being deep beneath the Earth's surface, subjected to high temperatures and the great pressure of the rock layers above it.
option_4: Igneous rock is formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava.
solution: (a)Sedimentary Rocks - Shale, Conglomerate, Limestone, Sandstone, Coal, Siltstone, Dolomite, Chalk, Clay, Bauxite, Diamictite etc. Igneous Rocks - Gabbro, Obsidian, Pumice, Granite, Mica, Quartz, Basalt, Diorite. Metamorphic Rocks - Marble, Slate, Gneiss, Quartzite, Granulite, Phyllite, Eclogite, Migmatite.

question: Pathans in North-West India organised the society of Khudai Khidmatgars, popularly known as Red Shirt, under whose leadership?
solution: (c)Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan (frontier Gandhi/Sarhadi Gandhi/ Badshah Khan/ Bacha Khan) - In 1921 he was elected president of a district Khilafat committee. Khudai Khidmatgar movement was founded in 1929. Award: Bharat Ratna (1987), He was the first non-Indian to receive this honour. Muhammad Ali Jinnah - Founder of Pakistan.

question: In which of the following States/Union Territories were the 36th National Games held?
solution: (c)Gujarat. The National Games 2022 was held across six cities, Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot, and Bhavnagar, in Gujarat.Winner of national games - In the softball game, the men’s title (Maharashtra) women’s title (Punjab). In hockey, (Karnataka). In the men’s football event, (West Bengal). The 37th edition will be hosted in Goa. National Games (motto)- Get Set Play.

question: Which of the following was established in Bombay in 1875?
solution: (d)Arya Samaj. It aims to reestablish the Vedas. Founder - Swami Dayanand Saraswati. The slogan of Arya Samaj was Krinvanto Vishwam Aryam'' which means' Make the World Noble'. Brahma samaj - Founded by Raja Ram Mohun Roy in 1828. Satyashodhak samaj founded by Jyotiba Phule in 1873, It is also known as the Society of Seekers of Truth. Sir Syed Ahmed Khan organised and founded the Aligarh Movement​ in 1875.

question: Which of the following options conveys the meaning of the word 'Republic' in the Indian Constitution?
solution: (a)Elected head. Republic - It is a state in which political power rests with the public and their representatives, in contrast with a monarchy. The concept of the Republic is taken from France. The Word Republic is mentioned in the Preamble. In India, the President of India is the elected head of the state. Words used in Preamble of Constitution - Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic, Justice, Liberty, Equality, Fraternity.

question: Who among the following was defeated in the battle of Chanderi in 1528?
solution: (d)Medini Rai. The battle of Chanderi (1528) :- Fought between Medini Rai and Babur. Battle won by Babur - First Battle of Panipat (1526) - Between Babar and Ibrahim Lodi. Battle of Khanwa (1527) - Between Babur and Rana Sanga. Battle of Ghaghra (1529) - Between Babur and Afghan.

question: The venue of the 2020 Olympic Games was _________ .
solution: (c)Tokyo. Medals won by India in Tokyo olympics :- Gold -Neeraj Chopra ( javelin throw), Silver - Mirabai Channu (Weightlifter), Ravi Kumar Dahiya (freestyle wrestling), Bronze - Indian hockey team ( men’s hockey), Lovlina Borgohain (women’s welterweight), PV Sindhu (women’s singles badminton). Olympic Games venue - 2024- Paris, 2028 - Los Angeles (USA), 2032- Brisbane (Australia).

question: 49. When was the International Day of the Girl Child 2021 celebrated?
solution: (d)11 October. International Girl Child Day - First time celebrated in 2012. It is celebrated by the United Nations General Assembly. Other important Days: 5 October - World Teachers' Day, 2 October - Gandhi Jayanti, 23 March - Sahid Diwas, 22 April - Earth Day, 5 June - Environment Day.

question: In January 2022, which State Government has extended its integrated initiative for the empowerment of persons with disabilities (PwDs) — the Bhima Bhoi Bhinnakhyama Samarthya Abhiyan (BBSA) - for the next five years?
solution: (a)Odisha. Bhima Bhoi Bhinnakhyama Samarthya Abhiyan (BBSA): Aim - To create an enabling environment to ensure equal opportunities, equity, social justice & empowerment of PwD. Other Scheme of Odisha: KALIA (Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation) Yojana - Launched on December 21, 2018, Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation”. Odisha Food Security Scheme (SFSS) - Launched on October 2, 2018.

question: In a race around a circular cycling track of 75 km, two cyclists are riding at a speed of 30 km/h and 25 km/h. After what time (in hours) will they meet at the point from where they started their journey?
solution:
(d)According to question,

Relative Speed = (30 - 25) = 5 km/hr

Required time = 755 = 15 hours

question: P is two times more efficient than Q. P is able to complete a piece of work in 40 days less than Q. Working together, the whole number of days taken by them to complete the work is: (Round off to the nearest integer)
solution:
(c)Ratio = P : Q

Efficiency = 3 : 1

Time = 1 : 3

Difference in time (2 unit) = 40 days

Total work = 402×3 = 60 units

Required time =603 + 1= 15 days

question: In an election, 2% persons enrolled in the voter list did not participate and 500 votes were invalid. Two candidates A and B fought the election, and A defeated B by 200 votes. If 43% of the persons enrolled in the voter list casted their votes in favour of A, then what is the number of the total casted votes?
solution:
(a)Let total number of voters enrolled = 100x

Voters participated in elections = 98x

Valid votes = 98x - 500

Votes in favour of A = 43% of enrolled voters = 43x

Votes in favour of B = (98x - 500) - 43x

According to question,

43x - [(98x - 500) - 43x] = 200

43x - (98x - 500) + 43x = 200

86x - 98x + 500 = 200

- 12x = -300 ⇒ x = 25

Total number of voters participated = 98x

= 98 × 25 = 2450

question:
Evaluate the following.

sin 25° sin 65°- cos 25° cos 65°.
solution:
(c)Sin 25° Sin 65° - Cos 25° Cos 65°

⇒ Sin 25° Sin 65° - Cos (90° - 65°) Cos(90° - 25°)

⇒ Sin 25° Sin 65° - Sin65° Sin 25°⇒ 0

population of village A= 10500×128 = 15750

question: What is the value of 64x³ + 38x²y + 20xy² + y³, when x = 3 and y = - 4 ?
solution:
(d)

(4x + y)³ = 64x³ + 48x²y + 12xy² + y³

According to question,

64x³ + 38x²y + 20xy² + y³ = (4x + y)³- 10x²y + 8xy²

= (4 × 3 - 4)³- 10 × 3²× (-4) + 8 × 3 × 16

= (8)³ + 360 + 384

= 512 + 744 = 1256

question: X and Y can complete a work in 9 days and 36 days, respectively. X begins to do the work and they work alternately one at a time for one day each. The whole work will be complete in:
solution:
(b)

According to question,

Work done in 1 cycle ( 2 days) = 4 + 1 = 5 units

Work done in 7 cycle ( 14 days) = 5 × 7 = 35 units

Remaining work = 36 - 35 = 1 unit

Time Required to complete remaining work = 14 days

Total time = 14 +14= 14 14 days

question: A shopkeeper uses 940 gm weight in place of one kg weight. He sells it at 4% profit. What will be the actual profit percentage? (rounded off to two decimal places)
solution:
(c).C.P : S.P.

Profit = 25 : 26

Weight = 940 : 1000

------------------------------

Total = 47 : 52

Required profit = 52-4747×100 = 10.64 %

question: If D is the midpoint of BC in ΔABC and ∠A = 90°, then AD =_______.
solution:
(c)Theorem : The mid point of hypotenuse of a right angled triangle is equidistant from all the vertices of the triangle (AD = BD = DC).

Therefore, AD = BC2

question: 5 women and 9 girls earn a total of ₹18,720 in 9 days, while 9 women and 16 girls earn a total of ₹52,080 in 14 days. How much will 12 women and 7 girls together earn (in ₹) in 13 days?
solution:
(d)Let the share of a woman and a girl be ‘a’ and ‘b’.

According to question,

(5a + 9b) × 9 = 18720 --------(1)

(9a + 16b) × 14 = 52080 --------(2)

From the above equations, we get ;

a = 200 and b = 120

Required amount = {(12 × 200) + (7 × 120)} × 13 = 42,120 Rs.

question: An electronic store owner allows two successive discounts of 20% and 25% on each item. The store has a reward points scheme which enables a customer to get free shopping worth ₹0.10 on every 1 reward point credited to the customer's account on previous purchases from the store. A customer decides to buy a laptop that is marked at ₹72,000. What will be its net selling price if he has 2850 reward points to his credit?
solution:
(b)Marked price of laptop = 72000 Rs.

According to question,

Net discount % = 20 + 25 -20 × 25100= 40%

Price of laptop after discount = 72000 × 60100 = 43200 Rs.

Required price = 43200 - (2850 × 0.10) = 42915 Rs.

question: What is the value of a³+ b³ + c³ , if (a + b + c) = 0 ?
option_1: a²+ b²+ c² - 3abc
option_4: a² + b²+ c² - ab - bc - ca
solution:
(c)Formula : (a + b + c)³ - 3abc = (a + b + c) ( a² + b² + c² + ab + bc + ca)

And we know, If (a + b + c ) = 0

Then,

a³ + b³ + c³ = 3abc

question:
Evaluate the following:

cos(36° + A) . cos(36° - A) + cos(54° + A) . cos(54° - A)
solution:
(d)Formula used: cos (A - B) = cosA . cosB + sinA . sin B

cos(36°+ A) . cos(36°- A) + cos(54° + A) . cos(54° - A)

⇒ cos(36° + A). cos(36° - A) + cos[90 - (36°+ A)] . cos[90 - (36° - A)]

⇒ cos(36° + A) . cos(36° - A) + sin (36°+ A) sin (36°- A)

⇒ cos[36°+ A - (36° - A)]

⇒ cos(2A)

What is the difference between the angle of pie-chart showing the expenditure incurred on binding and printing?

question: Let ABC, PQR be two congruent triangles such that angle A = angle P = 90°. If BC = 13cm, PR = 5cm, find AB.
solution:
(a)According to question,

BC = 13 cm = QR

PR = 5 cm = AC [ triangles are congruent ]

Using pythagoras theorem, (as ∠A = 90°)

AB =132 - 52 = 12 cm

question: The mean proportion between 7 and 112 is:
solution:
(b)According to question,

Mean proportional = 7×112 = 28

question: 4 women or 6 boys can finish a work in the same number of days. A Boy can finish it in 60 days. In how many days can 5 women finish the work, working together every day?
solution:
(c)According to question,

4W = 6B ⇒WB=32

Total work (60B) = 60 × 2

Required time = 60×25×3 = 8 days

question: What is the value of sec² 54° - cot² 36° + 32sin² 37° × sec² 53° + 23 tan60°?
solution:
(b) sec²54° - cot²36° + 32sin²37° × sec²53° +23tan 60°

⇒ sec²(90°- 36°) - cot²36° + 32sin²37° × sec²(90° - 37°) +23 tan 60°

⇒ cosec²36° - cot²36° + 32 sin²37° × cosec²37° + 23 tan 60°

⇒ 1 + 32 + 23 × 3⇒92

question: If the simple interest at the same interest rate on ₹500 for 4 years and ₹700 for 2 years, combined together, is ₹280, then what is the rate of interest?
solution:
(c)Simple interest = P × R × T100

According to question,

500 × R × 4100 + 700× R × 2100= 280

Rate of interest = 28034 = 8417%

question: A thief steals a van at 3:00 a.m. and drives it at a speed of 57 km/h. The thief is discovered at 4:00 am. and the owner starts the chase with another van at a speed of 76 km/h. At what time will he catch the thief?
solution:
(c)According to question,

Distance covered by thief in 1 hour = 57 km

Relative Speed = (76 - 57) = 19 km/hr

Time required to catch the thief = 5719 = 3 hours

Therefore, Required time = 4 : 00 am + 3hrs. = 7 : 00 a.m.

question: The present age of Rahim is five times the present age of his daughter, Savita. Seven years from now, Rahim will be three times as old as Savita. What is the present age (in years) of Rahim?
solution:
(b)Let the present age of Savita and Rahim be a year and b year.

According to question,

b = 5a --------(1)

(b + 7) = 3(a + 7)

(5a + 7) = 3a + 21

a = 7

Therefore, Present age of Rahim (b) = 5a = 35 years

Short trick :

(5 × 1) - (3 × 1) = (7 × 3) - (7 × 1)

2 units = 14 years

So the present age of Rahim(5 units) = 5 × 7 = 35 years.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

The boys and the teacher wants to win.
solution:
(d)want to win

According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, If two subjects are joined with the conjunction ‘and’ then it will be treated as a plural subject and it will take a plural verb with it. In the given sentence, ‘The boys and the teacher’ is a plural subject that will take ‘want’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘want to win’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

He was compelled by everyone to join the group.
solution:
(a)Demur- to object or show unwillingness.

Compelled- forced to do something.

Obscured- to hide or conceal.

Confessed- to admit or acknowledge.

Induced- to persuade or influence someone to do something.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

To kick the bucket
solution:
(d)To kick the bucket- To die

E.g.- The elderly man lived a long and joyful life, but eventually, he kicked the bucket in his sleep.

question:
79.Identify and correct the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the given sentence.

The Collector paid floral tributes to the statue of Mahatma Gandhi after hosting the flag.
solution:
(d)Hoisting

Correct Spellings- Floral, statue and Tributes.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

Do you know the old adage ‘the show must go on’?
solution:
(a)Misconstruction- a misunderstanding of something, especially a text or statement.

Adage- a short statement expressing a general truth.

Rebuke- to scold or criticize.

Dare- to have the courage to do something challenging.

Addiction- a strong dependence on something.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

She reminds me always that I________________to be a little more careful.
solution:
(b)have

The verb ‘reminds’ indicates an action in present tense. We generally use the semi-modal ‘have to’ with “I/you/we/they” to express a general obligation. Similarly, the given sentence expresses the obligation that I have to be careful.Hence, ‘have’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word given in brackets to fill in the blank.

Mr. Khanna is quite_______________(callous) towards the victims of earthquake.
solution:
(c)Sympathetic- showing concern and understanding towards the suffering or emotions of others.

Callous- a lack of concern for the feelings and suffering of others.

Rationalistic- based on or guided by reason and logic rather than emotions or feelings.

Unsympathetic- showing a lack of compassion, understanding, or concern towards others' feelings.

Non diplomatic- lacking tact or sensitivity in dealing with others.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below. While the first and the last sentences (S1 and S6) are in the correct order, the sentences in between are jumbled up and named P, Q, R, S. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

(S1)Newspapers, especially of the popular variety, aim to do two things: to inform and to entertain.

(P) Entertainment may be principally found in the centre pages of the newspaper in some of the feature articles and in some local news stories.

(Q) The principal aim of the short news report on the front pages is to inform.

(R) Most newspapers are published daily, and the news reporters must make sure that they have up-to-the minute news.

(S) In their news reports they will aim to create a sense of immediacy, to convey the impression that they have 'rushed' the news to the reader and 'that the information contained is the very latest."

(S6) Reporters also wish to create a sense of authenticity, that is, that their news is accurate and genuine.
solution:
(d)P, Q, R, S

Sentence P will follow sentence S1 as it states where the entertainment news can be found. And, Sentence Q states the aim of short news. So, Q will follow P. Further, Sentence R states the news reporters & Sentence S states their reports. So, S will follow R. Going through the options, option (d) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word from the sentence.

Ready

She was preparing dinner in an organised manner using well-equipped tools while listening to the radio.
solution:
(a)Preparing- being ready or making arrangements in advance.

Listening- giving attention to the sound.

Organised- arranged in a systematic manner.

Equipped- to take or to have the all the necessary items.

question: Identify how you will ask everyone if the children were not reading the books in passive voice.
option_1: Were the books being read by the children?
option_2: Were the books not being read by the children?
option_3: Were the book not being read by the children?
solution:
(b) Were the books not being read by the children?(Correct)

(a) Were the books being read by the children?(‘not’ is missing)

(c) Were the book not being read by the children?(Incorrect Noun)

(d) Were the children reading the books?(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
86. Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Hostile
solution:
(d)Unfriendly

Hostile- showing opposition, aggression, or unfriendliness.

Pleasant- nice, enjoyable, and friendly.

Hospitable- friendly to guests or strangers.

Empathetic- understanding and caring about others' feelings and experiences.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

The fact that God created man in his personal view by giving him an intellectual spirit elevates him above the beasts of the field.
solution:
(c)own image

The phrase "in his own image" is commonly used to describe the belief that God created human beings with characteristics or attributes resembling his own. Hence, ‘own image’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. During the summer, I noticed that the leaves of the tree were beginning to wither.

B. I am especially proud of it, not only because it has survived several winters, but because it occasionally produces luscious peaches.

C. The tree had grown against a warm wall on a sheltered side of the house.

D. Last summer, I spent many days in the garden watching thousands of ants crawling up the trunk of my prize peach tree.
solution:
(a)DCBA

Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main subject of the parajumble i.e. Last summer. And, Sentence C states that the tree had grown against the wall. So, C will follow D. Further, Sentence B states the narrator’s feeling towards the tree & Sentence A states that he noticed the leaves of the tree . So, A will follow B. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

Was the bag packed by Mary?
solution:
(d)Did Mary pack the bag?(Correct)

(a) Was Mary pack the bag?(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(b) Is Mary packing the bag?(Incorrect Tense)

(c) Do Mary pack the bag?(Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word 'Optimistic' from the given sentence.

After the incident, Radha prepared herself to stay positive even in gloomy days.
solution:
(d)Gloomy- unhappy, negative or depressed

Optimistic- having a positive attitude.

Stay- ​​to remain in a particular state or condition.

Incident- an event or occurrence.

Positive- having a confident attitude.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don't find any error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

After knowing truth, / the jury took the right decision / in the case.
solution:
(c)after knowing truth

Article ‘the’ will be used before ‘truth’ as we generally use the definite article ‘the’ with a specific noun. Hence, ‘after knowing the truth’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
92. In the following sentence, four words are underlined, out of which one word is Incorrectly spelt. Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word.

A lot of spontanity is required from the speaker in an extempore speech. The speaker is expected to brainstorm ideas and give speech instantaneously.
solution:
(d)spontanity

‘Spontaneity’ is the correct spelling.

question:
93. Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A person who believes that laws and governments are not necessary.
solution:
(c)Anarchist - A person who believes that laws and governments are not necessary.

Antagonist- a person who opposes or competes with another.

Antichrist- a person or force that opposes Christ.

Adversary- an opponent or enemy.

question:
94. Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Miss the boat
option_1: Missing a good opportunity
option_2: Missing your medium of travel
option_3: Missing good moments of your life
solution:
(a)Miss the boat- Missing a good opportunity

E.g.- She wanted to join the team, but she missed the boat because the registrations closed yesterday.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. The outcome is much more likely to be favourable if there is substantial international aid than if there is not.

B. Many of the underdeveloped countries will promote the growth of their economies in one way or the other, no matter whether they receive substantial outside aid in the process or not.

C. By substantial aid I mean not only large amounts of technical assistance but also of capital.

D. The character of that development, however, is likely to be strongly influenced by the types of and amounts of aid available.
solution:
(a)BDAC

Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Growth of the underdeveloped companies. And, Sentence D states the character of the development. So, D will follow B. Further, Sentence A states the outcome & Sentence C states an additional point of substantial aid. So, C will follow A. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
Cloze test-

The Sun is the star at the center of (96)_________Solar System. It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma. The Sun has inspired us since ancient times. It's central to mythology and religion in (97)_________ around the world. It keeps our planet warm enough for living things to grow. It gives us light so we can see. It is by far the most important (98)____________ of energy for life on Earth. It is about a hundred times as wide (99)____________ the Earth. If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no (100)________________ of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(c)the

We generally use definite article ‘the’ with single existing things. The given passage states that the Sun is a star at the center of the Solar System. Hence, ‘the’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test-

The Sun is the star at the center of (96)_________Solar System. It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma. The Sun has inspired us since ancient times. It's central to mythology and religion in (97)_________ around the world. It keeps our planet warm enough for living things to grow. It gives us light so we can see. It is by far the most important (98)____________ of energy for life on Earth. It is about a hundred times as wide (99)____________ the Earth. If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no (100)________________ of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(a)cultures

‘Culture’ means collective beliefs, values, customs, traditions shared among a group of people. The given passage states that it’s central to mythology and religion in cultures around the world. Hence, ‘cultures’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test-

The Sun is the star at the center of (96)_________Solar System. It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma. The Sun has inspired us since ancient times. It's central to mythology and religion in (97)_________ around the world. It keeps our planet warm enough for living things to grow. It gives us light so we can see. It is by far the most important (98)____________ of energy for life on Earth. It is about a hundred times as wide (99)____________ the Earth. If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no (100)________________ of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(b)source

‘Source’ means the origin, point of origin of something. The given passage states that It is by far the most important source of energy for life on Earth. Hence, ‘source’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test-

The Sun is the star at the center of (96)_________Solar System. It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma. The Sun has inspired us since ancient times. It's central to mythology and religion in (97)_________ around the world. It keeps our planet warm enough for living things to grow. It gives us light so we can see. It is by far the most important (98)____________ of energy for life on Earth. It is about a hundred times as wide (99)____________ the Earth. If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no (100)________________ of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(b)as

‘As...as’ is a comparative structure used to compare two things. The given passage states that It is about a hundred times as wide as the Earth. Hence, ‘as’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test-

The Sun is the star at the center of (96)_________Solar System. It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma. The Sun has inspired us since ancient times. It's central to mythology and religion in (97)_________ around the world. It keeps our planet warm enough for living things to grow. It gives us light so we can see. It is by far the most important (98)____________ of energy for life on Earth. It is about a hundred times as wide (99)____________ the Earth. If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no (100)________________ of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(d)existence

‘Existence’ means the state of being alive. The given passage states that If there were no sun, many things wouldn't occur like photosynthesis or the presence of oxygen, which would have caused no existence of life. Hence, ‘existence’ is the most appropriate answer.
